skill.name: antipattern-catalog
skill.description: Document technical debt, anti-patterns, and patterns to avoid from analyzed frameworks. Use when (1) creating a "Do Not Repeat" list from framework analysis, (2) categorizing observed code smells and issues, (3) assessing severity of architectural problems, (4) generating remediation suggestions, or (5) synthesizing lessons learned across multiple frameworks.
skill.summary: Document technical debt, anti-patterns, and patterns to avoid from analyzed frameworks. Use when (1)...
skill.author: Dowwie

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only a SKILL.md markdown file with 256 lines of anti-pattern catalog guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system operations, or environment variable access exists. All static findings are false positives triggered by documentation patterns (code examples showing anti-patterns, markdown syntax, and severity level terminology that the scanner misinterpreted as security-related keywords).

content.value_statement: Agent frameworks often contain hidden architectural problems that cause bugs and technical debt. This skill provides a catalog of anti-patterns to identify, categorize, and remediate issues across structural, behavioral, observability, and performance categories.
actual_capabilities: Categorize observed issues into structural, behavioral, observability, and performance categories
Assess severity using Critical, Major, Minor, and Cosmetic levels
Generate remediation suggestions for each identified anti-pattern
Create Do Not Repeat checklists for future projects
Document anti-patterns with standardized catalog entry templates
Synthesize findings from multiple framework analyses
limitations: Does not execute code or perform automated analysis
Does not integrate with external tools or APIs
Does not modify files or project code directly
Relies on manual input of observations and findings

output_examples.input: What are the main anti-patterns to avoid in agent framework design?
output: Structural Anti-Patterns: Deep Inheritance (5+ class levels), God Class (50+ methods), Circular Dependencies, Leaky Abstraction, Premature Abstraction
Behavioral Anti-Patterns: Hidden State Mutation, Implicit Contracts, Silent Failures, Infinite Loop Risk, Race Conditions
Observability Anti-Patterns: Hidden LLM Response, Opaque Errors, No Tracing, Swallowed Context, Missing Metrics
Performance Anti-Patterns: Sync in Async, N+1 Queries, Unbounded Memory, Eager Loading, No Caching

output_examples.input: Help me document a silent failure anti-pattern I found
output: Problem: try/except blocks that swallow exceptions and return null
Impact: Errors are lost permanently, making debugging impossible
Remediation: Capture full error details and return structured error responses

best_practices: Prefer composition over deep inheritance hierarchies (max 3 levels)
Always expose raw LLM responses with token counts and model metadata
Never swallow exceptions; always log errors with context and traceback
anti_patterns: Swallowing exceptions with empty except blocks (hides errors permanently)
Deep inheritance chains (6+ levels makes code flow impossible to trace)
Silent tool failures that return null instead of propagating error details

faq.question: What platforms are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code environments.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of anti-patterns this skill can catalog?
faq.answer: There is no fixed limit; the catalog scales to include any number of documented patterns.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with my existing CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: This skill provides documentation templates; integration requires external tooling for automated scanning.

faq.question: Is my analysis data stored or shared?
faq.answer: All analysis is performed within your session; no data leaves your environment.

faq.question: What should I do if anti-patterns are detected in my codebase?
faq.answer: Use the remediation guidance in the catalog to apply fixes and add items to your Do Not Repeat checklist.

faq.question: How does this skill compare to static analysis tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides expert guidance and categorization; static analysis tools automate detection but require different setup.
